entry.tran: 使减至最低程度;使保持最低程度
entry.def: If you minimize a risk, problem, or unpleasant situation, you reduce it to the lowest possible level, or prevent it increasing beyond that level.

example.ex: Concerned people want to minimize the risk of developing cancer...
example.tran: 相关人员希望尽可能降低罹癌风险。

example.ex: Many of these problems can be minimised by sensible planning.
example.tran: 这些问题很多可以通过合理安排尽可能避免。

entry.tran: 对…轻描淡写；使显得不重要
entry.def: If you minimize something, you make it seem smaller or less significant than it really is.

example.ex: Some have minimized the importance of ideological factors...
example.tran: 有些人淡化了意识形态因素的重要性。

example.ex: At his trial, he tried to minimize his behavior.
example.tran: 接受审判的时候，他企图对自己的行为轻描淡写。

entry.tran: 把(计算机屏幕上的窗口)最小化
entry.def: If you minimize a window on a computer screen, you make it very small, because you do not want to use it.

example.ex: Click the square icon again to minimize the window.
example.tran: 再次点击正方形图标，把窗口最小化。

means.word_mean: 1. reduced to the smallest possible size or amount or degree
